Internet access across Ethiopia's capital city has been shut down after soldiers are seen marching toward the prime minister's palace NPR's Eyder Peralta reports they were demanding a salary increase
Ethiopia is that a pivotal moment in history right now it's new prime minister ... has pushed dramatic reforms
He's fired the country's intelligence chief and allowed politicians previously branded as terrorists to come back home but back in June I'll be survived a grenade attack to the site of hundreds of troops marching toward his residence has sparked fear of a coup
